intro: Dortmanna subpubera, commonly known as the hairy Dortmanna, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is typically found in moist, calcareous soils in temperate regions. Dortmanna subpubera is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
